block.label: Logistics

radio.label: Location
radio.title: Sample Source (web) / Location (web to clt)
radio.row: Oi Research- Online Interactive Research Limited

text.label: LocationCode
text.title: This is used to assign each location's unique identifying code from the Location question row label. Do not edit.

block.note: Edit logic based on country - if one country, use "True", if multiple countries, assign based on sample company. Make sure field department knows to alert you if they are adding a sample company

html.label: Intro
html.p:
Hello and welcome to our survey!
THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR PARTICIPATION. THIS STUDY IS VERY IMPORTANT TO US AND WE ASK THAT YOU ANSWER EACH QUESTION CAREFULLY AND COMPLETELY.
WHILE GOING THROUGH THE SURVEY, PLEASE USE THE SCROLL BAR ON THE RIGHT AND BOTTOM OF YOUR SCREEN TO MOVE UP AND DOWN THROUGH QUESTIONS AND IMAGES.  PLEASE REMEMBER THAT THERE ARE NO RIGHT OR WRONG ANSWERS. WE ARE ONLY INTERESTED IN YOUR OPINIONS. 
THANK YOU AGAIN! LET’S BEGIN…

checkbox.label: S_PastParticipation
checkbox.title: Have you participated in a market research study within the past week, on any of the following topics?

checkbox.label: S_Industry
checkbox.title: Do you, or does anyone in your family work for any of the following industries?
checkbox.row: Advertising agency or Public Relations Firms
A graphic design or packaging firm
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of Clutter1 products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of Clutter2 products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of TestCat products

term.label: TERM_Industry
term.cond: (S_Industry.r1 or S_Industry.r2 or S_Industry.r3 or S_Industry.r6)

select.label: S_GroceryShop
select.title: How much of the household grocery shopping do you, yourself do?

radio.label: S_Gender
radio.title: Which of the following best describes how you identify?

radio.label: S_Frequency
radio.title: Please select how often you have purchased products in each of the categories listed below in the past 12 months in a grocery, supermarket or retail store.

radio.label: v_FreqClutter1
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - Clutter1 Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r1.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r1.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r1.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r1.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r1.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r1.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r1.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: v_FreqClutter2
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - Clutter2 Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r2.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r2.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r2.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r2.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r2.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r2.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r2.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: v_FreqTestCat
radio.title: Virtual for weighting - TestCat Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.TB.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.TB.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.TB.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.TB.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.TB.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.TB.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.TB.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: S_HowMany
radio.title: On average, when you purchase from each of the categories listed below, how many products do you typically purchase in a single shopping trip?

checkbox.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased1
checkbox.title: Which brand or brands of Clutter1 have you purchased in the past 6 months?

radio.label: S_Brand_BUMO1
radio.title: And which one brand of Clutter1 have you purchased most often in the past 6 months?

checkbox.label: S_Brand_NonRejecter1
checkbox.title: Please select the brand(s) of Clutter1 that you would NOT consider purchasing in the future.

checkbox.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased2
checkbox.title: Please indicate which brand or brands of TestCat you have purchased over the past 6 months in a grocery, supermarket or retail store?
checkbox.row: PLEASE INSERT THE MOST COMMON CATEGORY BRANDS HERE

radio.label: S_Brand_BUMO2
radio.title: And which one brand of TestCat do you purchase most often in a grocery, supermarket or retail store?
radio.row: PLEASE INSERT THE MOST COMMON CATEGORY BRANDS HERE

checkbox.label: S_Brand_NonRejecter2
checkbox.title: Please select the brand(s) of [pipe: Category] that you would NOT consider purchasing in the future.

autofill.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased
autofill.title: Usage Past purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) - User/Non User for Database
autofill.row: Test Brand User - all test brands netted

autofill.label: S_Brand_BUMO
autofill.title: BUMO - User/Non User for Database
autofill.row: Test Brand User - all test brands netted

checkbox.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased3
checkbox.title: Which brand or brands of Clutter2 have you purchased in the past 6 months?

radio.label: S_Brand_BUMO3
radio.title: And which one brand of Clutter2 have you purchased most often in the past 6 months?

checkbox.label: S_Brand_NonRejecter3
checkbox.title: Please select the brand(s) of Clutter2 that you would NOT consider purchasing in the future.

block.label: Quotas
block.exec: if PhaseQ.r1: Phase.val=0 if PhaseQ.r2: Phase.val=1 if PhaseQ.r3: Phase.val=2

radio.label: Phase
radio.title: Phase

block.label: AgreementBlock
block.note: THIS QUESTION SHOULD BE LEFT IN TO ENSURE QUALITY OF INTERVIEWING AND THAT IT'S NOT A BOT TAKING THE SURVEY

radio.label: RedHerringCheck
radio.title: Which of the following is not a color?

radio.label: Agreement
radio.title:
Respondent Confidentiality Disclosure Agreement (RCDA)
Congratulations!
• Thank you for agreeing to participate in this consumer study on behalf of Behaviorally. Before you can participate in this research, we would like you to understand that it will involve Confidential Information and you must agree to these terms and conditions. If you do not agree, you will not be eligible to participate in this study. By signing this agreement, you agree as follows:
• You will use information or material disclosed to you or which may be available as part of this study only for the purpose of participating in this study, and you will not otherwise use the information or material for your own benefit or the benefit of any third party.
• You agree to keep confidential and not disclose, copy, transmit, or use for any purpose other than your participation in this study any information or material disclosed or made available to you as part of the study, including about products or packaging that may be disclosed to you directly or indirectly by participating in this study. Any disclosure, copying, transmitting or misuse of any information or material in any form (including hard copy and/or electronic/data) whether intentional or unintentional may subject you to disqualification, and any other remedies available to Behaviorally or its study partners in law or equity.
• You agree that Behaviorally (and its partners) will be irreparably harmed and monetary damages may not be adequate compensation if you fail to meet your obligations under this agreement, and that, in addition to other remedies, Behaviorally (or its partners) shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief to prevent any threatened or continued breach. The parties hereby waive any requirements for security for obtaining any provisional relief.
• Each of Behaviorally’s partners is an intended third-party beneficiary of this agreement and each partner may enforce the terms of this agreement.
As further detailed in our privacy policy (https://www.behaviorally.com/privacy-policy), we take reasonable precautions to protect the privacy and security of your information during the market research survey. All information collected as part of this survey is treated in accordance with our online privacy policy and is destroyed 2 months after you have taken this survey.
You will be compensated for your time, commitment, and confidential obligation.
Please confirm your acceptance of these terms by checking the agreement below.

row.label: r1
row.b: I hereby acknowledge and agree to the terms.

text.label: DateTime
text.title: DateTime
text.exec:
from datetime import datetime
cur_time = datetime.now() DateTime.val = cur_time.strftime("%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S")

pipe.label: continue_text
pipe.case: Please click the Continue button to proceed

html.label: Maximize
html.strong:
Throughout this survey, you are going to be shown several pictures. Please be sure that you maximize your window at this time, such that you can see these pictures with as much clarity as possible. You can also mouse over the images to see them magnified at any time.
Press F11 for full screen.

number.label: resp_id
number.title: Respondent ID

block.label: EyeFlowShelf

html.label: EyeFlow1
html.strong:
Assume you are doing your shopping from this category.
On your trip, you can navigate the shelves using your mouse to un-blur products which you may find in a store.
To start the navigation, please click on the 1st element that attracts you. Then navigate the shelf to un-blur.
When finished with the scene, all you need to do is click on the image one more time.
If you are ready, please click on the “next” button.

block.html: Remember to click/touch the image to start the exercise.

textarea.label: EF_Shelf_Practice

block.html: Here is another image. Remember to click/touch the image to start the exercise.

textarea.label: E_Flow_Ex_Shelf1

number.label: P_QuantityPurchased
number.title: Please go shopping for [pipe: Category], assuming you are on a typical shopping trip.

div.ul:
If you would like to see a close-up of a product, hover your mouse over the product.
If you would like to purchase a product, click on the product and use the "+/-" buttons to add quantity and click "Purchase"
To change your mind about purchasing a product, click on the "back" button or click on the shopping cart to remove products.
When finished with the shopping trip, click the "continue" button on the bottom of your screen.
Please be sure to view the entire shelf before proceeding. You may need to scroll over/down to do so.

number.label: P1_Total_Products
number.title: Total Products Purchased
number.virtual: data.val = sum([int(r.c1.val) for r in P_QuantityPurchased.rows if r.c1.val and int(r.c1.val) gt 0])

number.label: P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product
number.title: Total Quantity Purchased Per Product

checkbox.label: P1_Items_Bought
checkbox.title: Products Bought

checkbox.label: P1_Items_ClickedOn
checkbox.title: Products Clicked On

checkbox.label: P1_Items_ClickedOn_NotPurchased
checkbox.title: Products Clicked On, but Not Purchased
checkbox.row: All Items Clicked On Were Purchased

number.label: P1_Number_ClickedOn_Products_NotPurchased
number.title: # of Products Clicked On but NOT Purchased

checkbox.label: R_UnaidedBrand
checkbox.title: Thinking about the shopping trip you just completed, please let us know if you remember seeing any of the following product(s).

radio.label: Q_NewDiff
radio.title: During your shopping trip, did you notice anything new or different?

textarea.label: Q_Diff_OE
textarea.title: What did you notice that was new or different?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

checkbox.label: Q_Factor
checkbox.title: When you are shopping for product in the Test Category, which factors do you find to be important in making the choice of which product to purchase?

checkbox.label: Q_PurchaseDriver
checkbox.title: Please select from the following statements the reason(s) you decided to purchase [pipe: Brand] during this shopping trip.
checkbox.row: The product looks like something I would like to try
This is something I do not usually find but like

radio.label: Q_EaseOfShop
radio.title: How easy or difficult was it for you to find the product(s) you wanted to purchase during this shopping trip?
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

textarea.label: Q_Reason_OE
textarea.title: What specifically about this aisle layout made it [pipe: Q_EaseOfShop lower] the products you wanted?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

radio.label: Q_OA_Aisle
radio.title: What is your overall opinion of the aisle you just shopped?
radio.row: It was easy to understand were products were located
It was organized in a way that was easy to navigate
It allowed me to see new products I was not aware of
It was difficult to understand where products were located
It was organized in a way that was difficult to navigate

survey.note: DELETE FINDABILITY SECTION IF NOT NEEDED

block.label: Findability_Section
block.builder:title: Findability Section
block.html:
Now I am going to show you the display of [pipe: Category] products again.
This time, you will be looking for one particular item.
Please find [pipe: Finda].
When you find this product, please use your mouse and click on the center of the product to select it.

number.label: F1
number.title:
Again, you are looking for:
[pipe: Finda upper]

radio.label: F1_Item_Found
radio.title: Product Found

radio.label: EaseOfFind
radio.title: How easy or difficult do you think it was to find this product?
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

radio.label: vEaseOfFind
radio.title: DO NOT MODIFY: EaseOfFind - Filtered by Correctly Located
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

survey.note: EYEFLOW PACK IS NOT STANDARD IN SHOPPER FLASH. DELETE IF NOT NEEDED.

block.label: EyeFlowPack

pipe.label: EF_Comp1
pipe.title: Pack Practice - Comp1 - Use IAT Image for Comp

pipe.label: EF_Comp2
pipe.title: Pack Practice - Comp2 - Use IAT Image for Comp

html.label: EF_Pack_Intro
html.strong:
We are going to take you on a visual trip through a store.
On your trip, you will see a series of individual products which you may find in a store.
Look at each product as if considering for purchase.
To start the exercise, using the mouse, click once on the 1st element that attracts you to un-blur that section and then continue your pack observation.
When finished with the scene, all you need to do is click on the image one more time.

block.html: Remember to click/touch the image to start the exercise.

textarea.label: EF_Pack_Practice_Comp1

block.html: Here is another image. Remember to click/ touch the image to start the exercise.

textarea.label: E_Flow_Ex_Pack1

block.html: Here is another image. Remember to click/touch the image to start the exercise.

textarea.label: EF_Pack_Practice_Comp2

block.label: Attitudinal
block.html:
For the next few questions, please focus your attention on the [pipe: Brand] packaging you see here.
[pipe: PH_IMG]

radio.label: Q_OA
radio.title: How much do you like or dislike the [pipe: Brand] packaging?

checkbox.label: Q_PackAtt
checkbox.title: Do you think the [pipe: Brand] packaging is…

radio.label: Q_Communication
radio.title: [pipe: PH_IMG]
radio.comment:
How much do you agree or disagree that the following phrases apply to these [pipe: Brand] products?
These [pipe: Brand] products…
radio.row: Are made by a brand I can trust

radio.label: Straightliner
radio.title: DO NOT REMOVE OR MODIFY - Straightliner Punch

radio.label: Q_Value
radio.title: How do you feel about the value of these [pipe: Brand] products, assuming they are available at the prices below?

radio.label: Q_PI
radio.title: How likely would you be to buy these [pipe: Brand] product, if they were available at the following prices?

radio.label: Q_PropensityToBuy
radio.title: Assume for a moment that these products were available at your local store for [pipe: Price]. Considering your next 10 purchases of [pipe: Category], would you purchase one of these [pipe: Brand] products...
radio.row: 9 or 10 times out of 10 purchases of [pipe: Category]
6 to 8 times out of 10 purchases of [pipe: Category]
3 to 5 times out of 10 purchases of [pipe: Category]
1 or 2 out of 10 purchases of [pipe: Category]

html.label: IM0a
html.span:
You are now going to see a series statements and products on your screen.
Please pay attention as it’s going to be very quick.
As soon as a statement appears you will have 5 seconds to click on the product that best fits with the statement.
Ready? Please continue.

strong.span: Again, for statement, you will have 5 seconds to click on the statement on the product that fits it best.

radio.label: IM0A_[loopvar: label]

float.label: packAttTimesnlive_[loopvar: label]
float.title: Pack Attribute Times
float.exec: for row in packAttTimes_[loopvar: label].rows: packAttTimesnlive_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val = float(packAttTimes_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val or 0)

html.label: IM1
html.span:
You are now going to see another series of statements and products on your screen.
Please pay attention as it's going to be very quick.
As soon as a statement appears you will have 5 seconds to click on the product that best fits with the statement.
Ready? Please continue.

radio.label: IM1B_[loopvar: label]

float.label: packAttTimesnlivea_[loopvar: label]
float.title: Pack Attribute Times
float.exec: for row in packAttTimesa_[loopvar: label].rows: packAttTimesnlivea_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val = float(packAttTimesa_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val or 0)

textarea.label: IM2_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: What specifically about the [pipe: Brand] made you say it was "[loopvar:statement]" than the others?

checkbox.label: vIM1B
checkbox.title: Test IAT Summary Table
checkbox.virtual:
if IM1B_1.c1: vIM1B.r1.c1.val=1 if IM1B_1.c2: vIM1B.r1.c2.val=1 if IM1B_1.c3: vIM1B.r1.c3.val=1
if IM1B_2.c1: vIM1B.r2.c1.val=1 if IM1B_2.c2: vIM1B.r2.c2.val=1 if IM1B_2.c3: vIM1B.r2.c3.val=1
if IM1B_3.c1: vIM1B.r3.c1.val=1 if IM1B_3.c2: vIM1B.r3.c2.val=1 if IM1B_3.c3: vIM1B.r3.c3.val=1
if IM1B_4.c1: vIM1B.r4.c1.val=1 if IM1B_4.c2: vIM1B.r4.c2.val=1 if IM1B_4.c3: vIM1B.r4.c3.val=1
if IM1B_5.c1: vIM1B.r5.c1.val=1 if IM1B_5.c2: vIM1B.r5.c2.val=1 if IM1B_5.c3: vIM1B.r5.c3.val=1
if not(data.c1.any): vIM1B.r99.c1.val=1 if not(data.c2.any): vIM1B.r99.c2.val=1 if not(data.c3.any): vIM1B.r99.c3.val=1
checkbox.row: Did not choose product for any statement

checkbox.label: Q_Layout
checkbox.title: Looking at the image of the test category you just shopped, which of the following statements reflect your opinion of the layout?
checkbox.row: I do not like the layout
Makes me aware of new products
Is easy to find the products I need
Has a good variety of items

radio.label: Q_Arrangement
radio.title: Based upon the shelf you see here, how is the shelf organized?

radio.label: Q_RecallProd
radio.title:
Please focus on the product in front of you as you answer the next few questions.
Do you recall seeing this product while shopping the store?

textarea.label: Q_LocOnShelf
textarea.title: Describe the location of this product on the shelf.

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

radio.label: Q_ExpectToFind
radio.title: Was this where you would expect to find this product?

textarea.label: Q_ExpectToFind_OE1
textarea.title: Why did you expect to find the product in this location?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

textarea.label: Q_ExpectToFind_OE2
textarea.title: Where in the aisle would you expect to find this product?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

number.label: Q_PriceExpectation
number.title: Looking at the product in front of you, how much would you expect to pay for the test brand product if it was available at your store today?
number.comment: Please enter a number in each space.
number.validate: if this.c1.ival+this.c2.ival+this.c3.ival+this.c4.ival==0: error("YOUR RESPONSE MUST BE GREATER THAN $0")

radio.label: Q_value
radio.title: How would you feel about the value of this Test Brand product, assuming it was available at a price of $XX.XX?

number.label: Q_GoodValue
number.title: What would you consider to be a price that would be low priced, but still a good value?

number.label: Q_Cheap
number.title: And what would be a price that would be so cheap you would question its quality?

number.label: Q_Worthit
number.title: And what would be a price that would be expensive but worth the price?

number.label: Q_TooExpensive
number.title: And what would be a price that would be so expensive that you would not buy it?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionImpact
checkbox.title: Thinking about the shopping experience you just conducted and your thought process in making your purchase decision, were any of the following helpful in this process?

radio.label: Q_OtherImpact
radio.title: Did you see any signs or other information on the shelf that helped you find the product you purchased?

checkbox.label: Q_HelpToFind
checkbox.title: Which of the below items helped you find the product you purchased?

textarea.label: Q_HelpToFind_OE
textarea.title: What, specifically, about this item, helped you find the product you purchased?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

radio.label: Q_RecallItems
radio.title: For each of the following images, please let us know if you recall seeing these items at the shelf?
radio.comment: Select one response for each image.

radio.label: Q_NotHelpful
radio.title: You mentioned that you remember seeing this item at the shelf.  Why didn’t you find this item to be helpful in finding your product?
radio.row: I did not pay attention to it
It did not apply to me

textarea.label: Q_NotUseful_OE
textarea.title: What, specifically, makes you say that this information was not useful?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

textarea.label: Q_Confusing_OE
textarea.title: What, specifically, makes you say that this information was confusing?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

textarea.label: Q_MadeEasier_OE
textarea.title: What else, if anything, would have made it easier for you to find or purchase the product you wanted?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

radio.label: Q_Signage
radio.title: Looking at the sign in front of you, do you remember seeing this during your shopping trip?

textarea.label: Q_Message_OE
textarea.title: What message did you take away from this sign?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

radio.label: Q_MessageHelpful
radio.title: Was this message helpful in making your purchase decision?

textarea.label: Q_MessageHelpful_OE
textarea.title: What, about this message, was helpful to you?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

textarea.label: Q_MessageUseful
textarea.title: What message would make this sign more useful to you and others?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

radio.label: Q_DisplayRecall
radio.title: Thinking about the shopping trip you just conducted do you remember any free-standing floor displays in the aisles of the store?

radio.label: Q_DisplayLoc
radio.title: Where, in the store, did you see the display?

textarea.label: Q_NoticeFirst_OE
textarea.title: What did you notice first about the display?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

textarea.label: Q_Communicate_OE
textarea.title: What did the display communicate to you?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

textarea.label: Q_Useful_OE
textarea.title: What would make this display more useful to you and others?

comment.em: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.label: Class

strong.em: Now, just a few questions for classification purposes…

select.label: S_State
select.title: Please select the US state in which you currently live.

select.label: C_Employment
select.title: Which of the following best describes your current employment status?
